page.title: 02Introduction:Continued
page.content: built in the local limestone and a few have thatch,although more tend to have slate as roofing material. Interesting buildings in the village would include the{Church,}dedicated to St. Nicholas,the{Chapel and Manse,}the recently restored{watermill,}new dwellings,and the{Wood's Memorial {Hall. The village is fortunate in having various clubs and organisations. {The school}is centrally placed, and currently has 140 children on its role. On its outer edges is{Wakefield {Lodge Estate,}with its fine mansion,and{Potterspury Lodge,}the old {Manor House,}now a{Steiner School.} Several farms are dotted around the edge of the village. The village also has two public houses, the{Cock}and the{Old Talbot,}and an{antique shop.
